thread.title: One historic Florida city among America's Best Small Towns
thread.title_full: One historic Florida city among America's Best Small Towns | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Zach Dennis
title: One historic Florida city among America's Best Small Towns
text:
The Huffington Post has found a small town in Florida to be one of the best in America, and it is nearby.
Everglades City, a two-hour drive southwest, has been listed among the 11 best small towns to spend a weekend trip in America by the Huffington Post . Other entries included Fredericksburg, Texas; Healdsburg, Calif.; Gallup, N.M.; Beaufort, S.C.; Deadwood, S.D.; Traverse City, Mich.; Port Townsend, Wash.; Coming, N.Y.; Estes Park, Colo.; and Woods Hole, Mass.
Everglades City This isn’t the first time that the small Florida town has been listed as the best in something before.
The Huffington Post already labeled the town one of the coolest small towns in America earlier this year and heralded it for being “the gateway to the unique mangrove estuaries and 10,000 Islands of Everglades National Park.” It also spoke highly of the stone crabs at the Seafood Depot.
Read more at The Huffington Post .
</span
